Title: I Cried from the Depths

Verses.1: Out of the depths, I cried to You, LORD,
Verses.2:
Lord, hear my voice.
Let Your ears be attentive
	to my cry for mercy.
Verses.3:
If You, LORD, kept a record of ungodliness,
	then, Lord, who could stand?
Verses.4:
But with You, there is forgiveness,
	so that You may be revered.
Verses.5:
I wait for the LORD, my soul waits,
	and in His word I put my hope.
Verses.6:
My soul waits in hope for the Lord,
	more than the night-watch waits for the dawn.
Yes, more than the night-watch waits for the dawn,
Verses.7:
Israel waits for the LORD.

For with the LORD there is mercy,
	and with Him redemption in abundance.
Verses.8:
And He will redeem Israel
	from all their ungodliness.

Changes: 2023-08-23 - Paul Prins: First translation of psalm 130 based on Greek, Latin, and some Hebrew
